1.Editable Profile Information: Users can enter and update their name, bio, and contact details directly on the card
2.Image Upload: Supports uploading a profile picture, which is displayed within a retro-style frame
3.Custom Stickers & Labels: Users can personalize their card by selecting and placing stickers, speech bubbles, and comic-style labels dynamically
4.Reset to Default: A quick reset option allows users to restore the card to its original design and layout
5.Downloadable Business Card: Users can save their customized business card as an image file for easy sharing or printing
6.Interactive Drag & Drop Elements: Enables repositioning of text, images, and stickers for a more personalized design experience

1. Create a theme-based gallery interface displaying categorized coloring pages (nature, animals, fantasy) with thumbnail previews and selection capability
2. Implement a coloring workspace with color palette selection, brush size options, and an active drawing area that responds to user input
3. Develop zoom functionality allowing users to magnify specific areas of the coloring page between 50% to 200%, maintaining color precision during zoomed editing
4. Create a texture effects system offering at least 5 different patterns (e.g., gradient, stipple, crosshatch) that can be applied to colored areas
5. Implement artwork saving functionality that stores the colored image with all applied effects in common image formats (PNG, JPEG) while preserving the ability to resume editing

1. Implement code input interface allowing users to paste or upload code snippets, supporting multiple programming languages with syntax highlighting
2. Calculate and display cyclomatic complexity metrics for each function/method in the code, highlighting sections that exceed defined thresholds (e.g., complexity > 10)
3. Analyze and visualize nesting depth of code blocks, marking areas where nesting exceeds 3 levels
4. Detect and highlight duplicate code segments, showing similarity percentage and locations of duplicated blocks
5. Generate an interactive visualization dashboard showing complexity metrics with heat maps and charts for different code sections
6. Provide specific refactoring suggestions for identified complex code sections, including example implementations for improvement

1. project list
 2. code highlight block
 3. project description card
 4. technology tab
 5. repository link
 6. copy code button

1. User registration and login: Support user registration, login and third-party account login.
2. Post questions and answers: Users can post technical questions and answer questions from others.
3. Code snippet highlighting: Support code snippet highlighting in multiple programming languages for easy reading and understanding.
4. Tag classification system: Categorize posts through tags to make it easier for users to find relevant content.
5. Search function: Powerful search engine, support multi-dimensional search by keyword, tag, user, etc.
6. Likes and comments: Users can like an answer and leave a comment below it.
7. User Reputation System: Motivate users to actively participate and contribute through a points and tier system.
8. Private messages and notifications: Users can send private messages to each other, and the system will automatically send relevant notifications and reminders.
9. Topic subscription: Users can subscribe to topics or tags of interest to get the latest related content.
10. Mobile optimization: Optimize the browsing and usage experience of mobile devices, and support participation in discussions anytime, anywhere.

1. Create a dance style selection interface with categories (hip-hop, salsa, ballet) including preview animations for each style
2. Implement an interactive tutorial system that displays step-by-step dance move instructions with visual demonstrations and timing indicators
3. Develop a music playlist system that allows selection and playback of dance songs, with controls for play, pause, skip, and volume
4. Create a competitive dance-off mode where users can challenge others, with real-time scoring based on move accuracy and timing
5. Implement a scoring and leaderboard system that tracks and displays user performance metrics, including dance accuracy percentages and high scores
6. Generate performance reports showing dance style preferences, accuracy trends, and competition history for each user

1. works grid display
 2. works detail page
 3. creation process display
 4. works categorization filter
 5. simple message board
 6. social sharing buttons

1. A basic information module displaying my name, job title, and contact details.
2. A vCard download feature for easy saving to mobile contacts.
3. A social media links module linking to my LinkedIn, GitHub, and other platforms.
4. Integration of a QR code generator for direct access to the business card page via scanning.
5. Display of my personal introduction and profile picture.

1. session introduction banner
 2. schedule grid display
 3. speaker information cards
 4. venue map integration
 5. registration form
 6. countdown display

1. Create an expense input form with fields for amount, date, category (dropdown with common expense types), and description
2. Implement a budget setting interface where users can define monthly spending limits for each expense category
3. Create a real-time expense tracking system that automatically updates remaining budget when expenses are added and triggers notifications when spending exceeds 80% of the category limit
4. Generate interactive pie charts and bar graphs showing expense distribution across categories and budget vs. actual spending comparisons
5. Develop a monthly financial report generator that includes total spending, category-wise breakdown, budget adherence statistics, and spending trends
6. Implement a persistent storage system to save and retrieve expense data, budget settings, and user preferences across sessions

1. Create a festival setup interface where users can select festival location, date range, and initial budget with an interactive map for venue selection and calendar for date picking
2. Implement an artist booking system with searchable database of artists by genre, availability, and booking fee, allowing users to create and manage their festival lineup with drag-and-drop functionality
3. Develop a financial management system tracking ticket sales, vendor revenue, artist payments, and operational costs with real-time budget updates and profit/loss projections
4. Create a dynamic event simulation system that generates random events (weather changes, artist cancellations, equipment failures) and calculates their impact on festival attendance and satisfaction
5. Generate post-festival reports showing attendance metrics, financial performance, attendee satisfaction ratings, and comparison with competing festivals in the same timeframe

1.Film Filter System – A variety of film-style filters to achieve different aesthetic effects
2. Multiple Upload Methods – Support for drag-and-drop, local file selection, and possibly cloud imports
3. Editing Tools – Adjustments such as brightness, contrast, saturation, and other fine-tuning options
4. Real-time Preview – Instant preview of filter effects before applying them
5. Export Options – Allow users to export images in different formats (JPEG, PNG, TIFF, etc), qualities, and sizes
6. User-friendly Interface – An intuitive UI/UX design to ensure a smooth editing experience
7. Performance Optimization – Fast processing to apply filters and adjustments efficiently

1. Create a tool that generates harmonious color palettes based on color theory.
2. Allow users to select a base color using a color picker or hex code input.
3. Generate complementary, analogous, triadic, tetradic, and monochromatic color schemes.
4. Provide a preview panel showing how the palette looks in UI examples (buttons, headers, etc.).
5. Allow users to export the palette in various formats (CSS variables, SCSS, JSON, SVG).

1. Implement a search interface with filters for material type (books, articles, etc.), subject categories, and keywords, displaying results in a paginated list with preview information
2. Create a hierarchical category browsing system with main categories and subcategories, showing the number of resources in each category
3. Develop a resource viewer interface with text highlighting tools, bookmark functionality, and a side panel for note-taking
4. Implement a data storage system for saving user-specific data (highlights, bookmarks, and notes) with automatic synchronization
5. Create a personal dashboard showing recently accessed materials, saved bookmarks, and a compilation of notes organized by resource
6. Implement a recommendation system based on user's browsing history and saved materials

1.Product Photography Carousel: Supports both manual and automatic image slideshows, allowing users to swipe or click arrows to navigate through the portfolio
2.Video Playback Interaction: Clicking on a video thumbnail opens a pop-up player with full-screen viewing and playback controls
3.Sticky Navigation Bar: The navigation bar remains fixed at the top while scrolling, ensuring easy access to different sections at all times
4.Collapsible Services List: Clicking the "+" icon expands or collapses detailed service descriptions, enhancing user interaction
5.Image Lightbox Viewing: Clicking on a photography piece opens a full-screen mode with left/right swipe navigation for seamless browsing
6.Contact Form Submission: Users can fill in their name, email, and inquiry details, then submit the form for business inquiries

1. Create a language selection interface where users can choose their target language and preferred difficulty level (beginner/intermediate/advanced)
2. Implement a word database system that stores and manages vocabulary categorized by language, difficulty level, and topics
3. Develop an interactive quiz interface that presents words (through audio or definition) and validates user-input spellings against the correct spelling
4. Create a real-time feedback system that immediately indicates correct/incorrect spellings and displays the correct spelling for wrong answers
5. Implement a progress tracking system that records quiz scores, tracks improvement over time, and displays historical performance graphs by topic and difficulty level

1. Prominent Brand Identity: A visually striking design that highlights the company’s heritage, craftsmanship, and values
2. Core Business Modules: Sections dedicated to the company’s products, manufacturing processes, and industry expertise
3. Dynamic News Display: A continuously updated news section featuring company announcements, industry trends, and press releases
4. Recruitment Information: A careers section showcasing job openings, company culture, and application details
5. Responsive and Interactive Design: Ensuring seamless functionality across desktop and mobile devices while incorporating modern UI/UX elements for an engaging experience

web_name: Markdown Note Editor with Local Storage
id: Markdown Note Editor with Local Storage--all
ques:
1. Create a simple browser-based Markdown editor for taking notes.
2. Implement live preview to show formatted text alongside Markdown input.
3. Save notes automatically to browser's local storage.
4. Add basic organization features like note titles and creation dates.
5. Include a simple export function to download notes as .md or .txt files.

1. question generator
 2. answer input box
 3. correct or incorrect decision
 4. scoring system
 5. difficulty level selection
 6. result statistics

1. Create a symptom logging interface where users can input symptom name, severity rating (scale 1-10), date/time, and optional notes
2. Implement a data storage system to persist symptom entries with proper validation (required fields, valid severity range, valid dates)
3. Create a symptom history view that displays all logged symptoms in chronological order with filtering options by date range and symptom type
4. Generate line graphs showing severity trends over time for each symptom, with options to overlay multiple symptoms for comparison
5. Create a summary report showing frequency of symptoms, average severity, and identification of peak severity periods
6. Implement a quick-log feature for recurring symptoms that auto-fills previous symptom details for faster entry

 3. timer
 4. move count
 5. completion decision
 6. replay button

1. Mood Selection Interface - Users can choose from a predefined list of common moods or input custom emotional states to begin playlist generation.
2. Playlist Generation Engine - Automatically creates personalized playlists by analyzing and matching songs based on mood-appropriate tempo, lyrical content, and music genre.
3. Song Database Integration - Accesses a comprehensive library of songs across various genres and styles to provide diverse playlist options.
4. Playlist Saving Functionality - Allows users to store their created playlists within the application for future access and enjoyment.
5. Playlist Sharing Options - Enables easy sharing of personalized playlists through social media platforms, messaging apps, or other sharing methods.
6. User Account Management - Users can create and manage accounts to save preferences, track playlist history, and access additional features.
7. User Interface Customization - Provides a visually appealing and intuitive interface that adapts to different screen sizes and devices for optimal user experience.

1. audio player
 2. playlist
 3. album cover display
 4. lyrics/profile display
 5. category tags
 6. share buttons

1. Create an interactive star map interface with pan and zoom capabilities, allowing users to navigate through the virtual night sky using mouse/touch controls
2. Implement a layer toggle system with controls for showing/hiding constellation lines, star names, and celestial object information overlays
3. Develop a time simulation system with date/time picker controls that updates the star map to show accurate celestial positions for the selected datetime
4. Create a celestial object database storing information about stars, planets, and constellations, including names, coordinates, and educational facts
5. Implement an object identification system that displays detailed information cards when users click on celestial objects in the star map

1. Create a task creation interface where managers can input task details including title, description, required skills, deadline, and estimated completion time
2. Implement an employee profile system to maintain records of each employee's skills, current workload, and task history
3. Develop an automated task assignment algorithm that matches tasks to employees based on their skills and current workload to ensure even distribution
4. Create a task tracking dashboard showing task progress status (not started, in progress, completed), deadline alerts, and workload distribution across team members
5. Generate detailed reports on task completion rates, employee workload distribution, and deadline compliance with filterable date ranges

1. Develop a simple tool to generate secure random passwords.
2. Allow users to specify password length (8-32 characters).
3. Include toggles for character types (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special characters).
4. Provide a strength indicator for generated passwords.
5. Add a one-click copy to clipboard function.

1. Implement an image upload interface that allows users to select and preview their photos as background images, supporting common formats (JPG, PNG) with a minimum resolution of 1080p
2. Create a template selection system with at least 5 pre-designed layouts, showing preview thumbnails and allowing users to apply them to their uploaded image
3. Develop a text editor interface with controls for font selection (minimum 10 fonts), size adjustment (8-72pt), color picker (RGB/HEX), and text alignment options (left, center, right)
4. Implement drag-and-drop functionality for text positioning and a resizing handle system that maintains aspect ratio and text quality
5. Create a decorative elements panel with at least 20 shapes and icons that can be added, resized, and positioned on the image
6. Implement an export function that saves the final composition as a high-resolution image (minimum 1920x1080) in multiple formats (PNG, JPG) with quality options

1. User registration and login: Support user registration, login and social media account login.
2. Photo upload and management: Users can upload photos, fill in detailed descriptions and shooting parameters (such as camera model, exposure time, etc.).
3. Story Arrangement Feature: Allows users to arrange multiple photos into a complete story or album.
4. Social sharing: Users can share photo stories to social media platforms to increase exposure.
5. Comments and likes: Other users can comment and like photos and stories to drive engagement.
6. Tags and Classification System: Organize your photos with tags and categories for easy browsing and searching.
7. Privacy settings: Users can set the visibility of photos and stories, such as public, friends-only, or private.
8. Browse and search function: Provide powerful browsing and search functions to help users discover what they are interested in.
9. Responsive Design: Ensure that the platform is well displayed and used on a variety of devices (desktop, tablet, mobile).
10. Notification system: Users can receive notifications about new comments, likes, and followers to stay engaged with the community.

1. Standard 10×20 grid game board, seven Tetrimino shapes (I, O, T, S, Z, J, L) are randomly generated, and support rotation, basic moves, hard drops, and line elimination.
2. React Canvas rendering, responsive design adapts to desktop and mobile terminals, supports keyboard controls (arrow keys, space bars), code modularity and clear annotations.
3. Preview of the next block, current score display, game level indicator, start/pause button, and game over screen with restart option.
4. Difficulty increases over time (speed increase), basic collision detection, wall kick mechanic, and ghost block function (showing where you landed).

1. Build a tool that allows users to upload images for editing and processing.
2. Implement image resizing with preset dimensions and custom inputs.
3. Add crop functionality with visual selection area.
4. Include rotation and flip controls.
5. Provide basic adjustment tools (brightness, contrast, saturation).
6. Enable applying simple filters (grayscale, sepia).
7. Enable downloading processed images in multiple formats.

1.Dimension Scores and Percentages: The test calculates and displays the scores and percentages for each of the four dimensions (E-I, S-N, T-F, J-P) based on the user's answers
2.Simple 20-Question Format: The test contains 20 multiple-choice questions, with two options for each question, covering all four dimensions
3.Result Calculation: The test calculates and displays the user's personality type and the scores for each dimension based on their answers
4.Personality Analysis: The test provides a personality analysis based on the results, including an overview of the user's personality traits
5.Strengths and Weaknesses Analysis: The test provides personalized analysis of the user's strengths and weaknesses, helping them understand their advantages and areas for improvement
6.Personal Development Suggestions: The test offers personalized improvement suggestions based on the user's personality type, helping them grow and develop

1. Implement a vehicle selection interface displaying a minimum of 5 different off-road vehicles with distinct specifications (speed, handling, acceleration) and visual previews
2. Create a physics engine that simulates realistic vehicle behavior including suspension, terrain interaction, and collision detection with obstacles
3. Develop a dynamic weather system that affects vehicle handling and track conditions (rain reduces traction, mud affects speed, etc.)
4. Design a race tracking system that records lap times, checkpoint times, and maintains a leaderboard for each track
5. Create at least 3 distinct off-road tracks with varying terrain types (mud, gravel, sand) and obstacles (rocks, logs, water crossings)
6. Implement a real-time performance dashboard showing current speed, lap time, position, and track progress during races

1. Create a video player interface with standard playback controls (play, pause, stop) and a timeline slider showing the current position in the video
2. Implement a selection mechanism allowing users to set start and end points on the video timeline for trimming, with visual markers indicating the selected region
3. Add file input functionality to load video files in common formats (MP4, AVI, MOV) with validation for supported formats
4. Implement video trimming functionality that creates a new video file containing only the selected portion while maintaining original video quality
5. Create a file save dialog allowing users to specify output filename and location for the trimmed video, with progress indication during processing

1. Create a search interface with a text input field where users can enter words or phrases to search across the book collection
2. Implement a data structure to store and index the book collection, including book content, page numbers, and paragraph locations
3. Develop a search algorithm that finds exact matches of the input word/phrase within the indexed book collection and returns matching books with their locations (page/paragraph)
4. Display search results as a clickable list showing book titles and the number of matches found in each book
5. Create a book viewer interface that opens when a search result is clicked, displaying the relevant page/paragraph with the searched term highlighted

1.Navigation Bar: Includes basic navigation items such as Home, Blog Categories, About Me, and social media links
2.Main Blog Card: Displays a full-width image with the title, author information, time, text preview, and a "Read More" button
3.Secondary Blog Card: A two-column layout showing thumbnails, titles, author information, short previews, and reading links
4.Sidebar: Contains About Me (avatar, short introduction, social media icons), Blog Category filtering, and Today's Recommendations (featured content card with thumbnails and short descriptions)
5.Responsive Layout: Ensures the website is well-displayed on both desktop and mobile devices, adapting to different screen sizes
